readability_reflection: String interpolation is much more readable as everything is just in one string and if you need to insert variables you can just put {} instead of having to break it into multiple strings concatenated.
comprehension_debugging: Concatenation slowed down how quickly I could understand the code snippets as I had to use more thinking power to understand how it all went together.
preference_rationale: I would prefer to use string interpolation going forward for future programming tasks. Readability is most important factor that influenced this decision which in turn makes it easier to understand.
learning_curve: For the most part I have used concatenation for working with strings, but only recently have been introduced to string interpolation when working with python. I find it easier now to work with string interpolation.
